abstract: Shareholders of CPI, which runs portrait studios in Wal-Mart stores, have backed all six of the company’s directors, impeding an effort by the hedge fund Ramius to replace two members of the board.
snippet: Shareholders of CPI, which runs portrait studios in Wal-Mart stores, have backed all six of the company’s directors, impeding an effort by the hedge fund Ramius to replace two members of the board.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders of CPI Corporation, which runs portrait studios in Wal-Mart stores and other locations, have backed all six of the company’s chosen directors, dealing a blow to an effort by the hedge fund Ramius to replace two members of the board, according to preliminary results released Wednesday.

headline.main: Ramius Loses Second Proxy Battle This Year
